title: Daily added sugar intake in England in 2008 - 2012 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Sugar intake in grams for 5 number of Age Groups.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams and Children 1.5-3 years has the lowest Sugar intake in grams.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Sugar intake in grams for 5 number of Age Groups.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Sugar intake in grams for 5 number of Age Groups.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams and Children 1.5-3 years has the lowest Sugar intake in grams.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
Age Group Children 4-10 years has the second highest value for Sugar intake in grams.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.

Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years is higher than any other Age Groups with value 74.2, followed by Children 4-10 years, and Adults 19-64 years. Down to Age Group Children 1.5-3 years with the lowest value 36.1.
The Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 1.32 times more Sugar intake in grams than average.
